lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: So what brings you in here today?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've been having this persistent cough for about three weeks now, and I'm also getting shortness of breath.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: I see. When did the cough first start?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It started about three weeks ago, maybe a little more. It's been getting worse lately.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Is it a dry cough or are you producing any mucus?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It's mostly dry, but sometimes I notice a little bit of yellowish mucus.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Have you had any fever or chills?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've had some low-grade fevers, maybe around 99 to 100 degrees.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any chest pain with the coughing?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: A little bit, yeah. It hurts when I take a deep breath sometimes.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Are you a smoker or have you been around anyone who is sick?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I quit smoking about two years ago. I smoked for about 15 years before that. And my coworker was sick last month with something similar.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Do you have any allergies or are you taking any medications currently?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I take lisinopril for my blood pressure, and I have a seasonal allergy to pollen.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How is your blood pressure been? Have you been checking it at home?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It's been okay, usually around 130 over 85. I check it once a week.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Have you noticed any wheezing or difficulty breathing at night?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Actually yes, I've been waking up at night a couple of times because I feel like I can't breathe well.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How about your appetite and weight? Any changes recently?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My appetite has been down a bit, but I haven't really noticed any weight loss.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any recent travel or exposure to chemicals or dust at work?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: No travel, but I work in a warehouse and there's a lot of dust there.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Alright. Let me listen to your lungs and we'll go from there.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Sounds good. I'm just worried it might be something serious since it's been going on so long.
